blocks.description: This equation shows the evaluation of the integral of \( \sin^2 \theta \) using trigonometric identities.

blocks.text: Now let us say, i.e., we wish to evaluate \( \int \sin^{2} \theta d\theta \)

blocks.description: This equation presents the integral of \( \sin^2 \theta \) expressed in terms of \( u \).
This shows the integration result of \( \sin^2 \theta \) after substituting for \( u \).

blocks.text: and if we note that the result may be expressed in the form \( \int \sin^{2} \theta d\theta = -\frac{1}{6} \cos ^{3} \theta + C \), wtih \( n \) being and equation.
